com.ibm.watson.dsm.engine

Class AbstractRuleEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.watson.dsm.util.AbstractListenerManager<IEvaluationListener,java.util.List<TupleState>,java.lang.Object,java.lang.Boolean>
      • com.ibm.watson.dsm.engine.AbstractRuleEngine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IRuleEngine
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AnalysisEngine, DSMEngine

    public abstract class AbstractRuleEngine
extends AbstractListenerManager<IEvaluationListener,java.util.List<TupleState>,java.lang.Object,java.lang.Boolean>
implements IRuleEngine
    A tuple application that processes notification of tuple changes (that is, additions or deletions) according to a set of rules. The rules are defined via a DSMSQLDefinition instance which defines a set of SQL tables and clauses which are executed until no new additions/deletions are made on the tables. The SQL tables map 1:1 onto the tuples that are used by this instance. Each tuple type that is to be exchanged with other tuple applications must
    • Be defined as a transport table
    • Have it's 'th column contain the key values registered in this instance's ITupleApplicationRegistry for the applications that wish to receive tuples from this instance.
    Input tuples, as defined in the DSMSQLDefinition, may be explicitly added or deleted through calls to addTuples(String, ITuple...). Tuple additions, either input or transport, are processed according to the following algorithm:
    1. more here
    Author:
    dawood

      • ACTION_TABLE_NAME

        public static final java.lang.String ACTION_TABLE_NAME
        The name of a table containing the definitions of actions (static Java methods) to be called at the end of rule evaluation. The table contains
        1. an integer that defines if the method is to be called synchronously (1) or asynchronously (0)
        2. A string naming the class and static method to call. The signature of the method void method(IRuleEngine r, TupleState begin, TupleState end, Object userData);
        3. A string that will be passed to the static method as userData.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • addTuples

        public void addTuples(java.lang.String table,
             ITuple... tuples)
               throws DSMException
        Description copied from interface: IRuleEngine
        A convenience method over IRuleEngine.addTuples(ITupleSet...) that create a tuple set for the given tuples using the underlying storage's ITupleSetDescriptor for the table with the given name. An ITupleSetDescriptor is created for the tuples using the named table's descriptor. Then call IRuleEngine.addTuples(ITupleSet...).
        Specified by:
        addTuples in interface IRuleEngine
        Parameters:
        table - name of table to which tuples will be added.
        tuples - one or more tuples to be added to the given table.
        Throws:
        DSMException

      • addTuples

        public void addTuples(ITupleSet... tuples)
               throws DSMException
        Description copied from interface: IRuleEngine
        Add the given input or transport tuples to the engine for processing. The input tuples must match the schema (type and value) of the table named in the tuple set's descriptor. If a Transport table, then the 'th column must contain an application instance id that matches that of this engine instance.
        Specified by:
        addTuples in interface IRuleEngine
        Parameters:
        tuples - a tuple set to be added to the table identified by the set's ITupleSetDescriptor.
        Throws:
        DSMException

      • evaluationComplete

        protected abstract void evaluationComplete()
                                    throws DSMException
        Provided so that sub-classes can log changes in state or other info. This is called after evaluation is complete. The transient tables will have been cleared, but the transport and input tables will be intact (and will be cleared after this returns).
        Throws:
        DSMException

      • sendTransportTuples

        protected abstract void sendTransportTuples(NamedTuples after)
                                     throws DSMException
        The subclass can decide about how/when to send the transport tuples. A normal engine will send them to their destination, but the analysis engine may not do anything with them.
        Throws:
        DSMException

      • applyChoose

        protected ITupleSet applyChoose(DSMSQLStatement s,
                    int recursiveQueryIndex,
                    ITupleSet tuples,
                    int maxCount,
                    int minCount)
                         throws DSMException
        Apply the choose=n and optional choose_min=m modifiers to results of this statements select clause. If m is specified and the tuples size is less than m, then clear the tuple set, otherwise, select as many as n tuples from the tuple set.
        Parameters:
        s -
        recursiveQueryIndex - -1 if this is a NOT recursive query, otherwise an index that is unique for each recursive query. This is currently only used by applyChoose(DSMSQLStatement, int, ITupleSet, int, int) so that the AnalysisEngine, which overrides that method, can distinguish different calls. The actual value is immaterial except that they must be unique across all recursive calls within a given evaluation request. In addition, the index must be repeatable for the same set of rules.
        tuples -
        Returns:
        never null, a modified set, possibly modifying the input.
        Throws:
        DSMException

      • getTargetedTransportTuples

        public java.util.List<ITupleSet> getTargetedTransportTuples(java.lang.String peerID)
        Description copied from interface: IRuleEngine
        Get the tuple set for all the transport tables for this instance of the rule engine that are should be sent to the application with the given node id. This is generally called after an evaluation by a communication system used to send transport tuples between engines.
        Specified by:
        getTargetedTransportTuples in interface IRuleEngine
        Parameters:
        peerID - the destination application instance of the tuples.
        Returns:
        never null, but perhaps empty collection.

      • getReadOnlyTupleStorage

        public IReadOnlyTupleStorage getReadOnlyTupleStorage()
        Description copied from interface: IRuleEngine
        Get a readonly interface to the tuple storage being used by the engine. Before using this, you may find IRuleEngine.getTuples(String),IRuleEngine.getTargetedTransportTuples(String) or IRuleEngine.getTransportDescriptors() sufficient.
        Specified by:
        getReadOnlyTupleStorage in interface IRuleEngine
        Returns:

      • getTuples

        public ITupleSet getTuples(java.lang.String table)
                    throws DSMException
        Description copied from interface: IRuleEngine
        Get all rows from the named table. In between rule evaluations, certain tables may be empty by definition. As such, the name of the table should probably only refer to tables that are known to contain values between executions. In the case of the rule language, this would be the persistent tables only.
        Specified by:
        getTuples in interface IRuleEngine
        Returns:
        null if the named table does not exist, otherwise a tuple set of table contents.
        Throws:
        DSMException - if table does not exist or other problem.
